page.title: 09THE TOWN OF KIRTON LINDSEY
page.content:
To the visitor or newcomer {Kirton {Lindsey }gives the impression of a maze. Its narrow streets follow little pattern and the recent introduction of a one-way system for vehicles accentuates the problems for motorists.
The town appears to have two centres. The commercial centre is around the Market Place, where the architecture and non-local building materials of the Town Hall reflect the town's former importance. The other centre is less commercial and is centered on { {St. Andrew's Church.}The area between the two centres has been filled with more recent housing.
The town's past is also reflected by the now defunct{Jail, and Courthouse.
